wikipedia_page.main: Richard Alfred William Heppolette (born 8 April 1949) is a former footballer born in Bhusawal, India. He appeared for various clubs including Preston North End, Leyton Orient, Crystal Palace, Chesterfield, Peterborough United and Hong Kong club Eastern AA.

link_mentions.page: History of Preston North End F.C.
response: New manager Alan Ball senior ensured that North End bounced straight back up as champions. Promotion was secured after Easter with a Ricky Heppolette goal in a 1–0 victory over the then-leaders Fulham. Preston struggled in the Second Division and narrowly avoided relegation in both 1972 and 1973. Ball left in 1973 and was succeeded by Bobby Charlton.
